titles.title: To authorize the Secretary of Agriculture to convey a parcel of unused agricultural land in Dos Palos, California, to the Dos Palos Ag Boosters for use as a farm school.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Forestry, Resource Conservation and Research.
Subcommittee on Forestry, Resource Conservation and Research Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Agriculture. H. Rept. 105-34.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 22.

action.text: Mr. Smith (OR) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture.
Senate Committee on Agriculture discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 4/16/1997--Passed House amended. Requires the Secretary of Agriculture to convey specified land in Dos Palos, California, to the Dos Palos Ag Boosters for use as a farm school. States that upon request of the Boosters such conveyance may be made to the Dos Palos School District. Requires, as consideration, that the transferee pay to the Secretary the fair market value of the land conveyed. Directs the Secretary to determine the fair market value.
